thread.title: Sayyaf men kidnap teacher in Sulu
thread.title_full: Sayyaf men kidnap teacher in Sulu

title: Sayyaf men kidnap teacher in Sulu
text:
Sayyaf men kidnap teacher in Sulu By Roel Pareño   
Col. Cirilito Sobejana, Joint Task Force Sulu, commander, identified the victim as Ibrahim Potong, a teacher of Jolo National High School. File photo 
ZAMBOANGA CITY , Philippines – Amid intensified military operations to rescue the remaining hostages of the Abu Sayyaf, a public school teacher was seized in Patikul town in Sulu on Friday afternoon. 
Col. Cirilito Sobejana, Joint Task Force Sulu, commander, identified the victim as Ibrahim Potong, a teacher of Jolo National High School. 
The victim was driving his motorcycle on his way home from Patikul to Maimbung when he was taken at gunpoint. 
Sobejana said they are coordinating with the family of the victim to determine the motive of the kidnapping. 
The incident has raised the number of people taken by Abu Sayyaf bandits to 32. 
The bandits are still holding 12 Vietnamese, seven Indonesians, five Malaysians, a Dutch man and six Filipinos. German hostage Juergen Kantner was beheaded on Feb. 26 after almost four months in captivity.   
The military has deployed thousands of troops in the Abu Sayyaf strongholds of Basilan, Tawi-Tawi and Jolo islands. 
Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana said they are also eyeing the deployment of drones and joint patrols with Indonesia and Malaysia to prevent cross-border kidnappings.
